title: The warmest cities in South America
summary: This chart shows the Temperature of the warmest City in South America .

The warmest City in South America is Bogota at 16 degrees , followed by Santiago at 20 degrees , Cordoba at 23 degrees , Lima at 25 degrees and Montevideo at 28 degrees , while the warmest of the displayed City is Belem at 36 degrees .
gold: The chart shows the temperature in six cities in South America . Belem is the warmest at just above 35 C . This is followed by Montevideo at just under 30 C .
